Sentencas: The Srn+1FenO3n+1 Ruddlesden-Popper (RP) perovskite family displays promising oxygen permeability and serves as a host stoichiometry for the design of solid oxide electrode materials.
Titulo: An ab initio study of the oxygen defect formation and oxide ion migration in (Sr1-xPrx)2FeO4±δ

Sentencas: A strategy to tune electronic and ionic properties is the introduction of substitutional dopants like Pr3+ to the A-site.
Titulo: An ab initio study of the oxygen defect formation and oxide ion migration in (Sr1-xPrx)2FeO4±δ

Sentencas: In this study, we investigate the bulk structural, electronic, and oxygen migration properties for the n = 1 RP perovskite (Sr1-xPrx)(2)FeO4 +/-delta (x = 0, 0.125, 0.25, 0.375, and 0.5).
Titulo: An ab initio study of the oxygen defect formation and oxide ion migration in (Sr1-xPrx)2FeO4±δ

Sentencas: The oxygen partial pressure is adjusted to elucidate how anodic and cathodic operating conditions influence the formation of oxygen defects.
Titulo: An ab initio study of the oxygen defect formation and oxide ion migration in (Sr1-xPrx)2FeO4±δ

Sentencas: Under anodic conditions, the oxygen vacancy is the dominant oxide defect for all dopant-configurations.
Titulo: An ab initio study of the oxygen defect formation and oxide ion migration in (Sr1-xPrx)2FeO4±δ

Sentencas: Under cathodic conditions, oxygen vacancy defects dominate for configurations from x = 0 to x = 0.375 while the oxygen peroxide interstitial defect becomes the primary defect for x = 0.5.
Titulo: An ab initio study of the oxygen defect formation and oxide ion migration in (Sr1-xPrx)2FeO4±δ

Sentencas: Next, we examine the relationship between Pr3+ concentration, iron oxidation state, and charge compensation with defect formation to explain the trends in vacancy and peroxide interstitial formation energies.
Titulo: An ab initio study of the oxygen defect formation and oxide ion migration in (Sr1-xPrx)2FeO4±δ

Sentencas: Results clarify the role of lanthanide A-site substitutional dopants on the electronic conductivity and oxide defect formation and migration in Sr-based RP perovskites.
Titulo: An ab initio study of the oxygen defect formation and oxide ion migration in (Sr1-xPrx)2FeO4±δ

Sentencas: These atomic-scale insights suggest design directions for RP perovskites in SOFCs.
Titulo: An ab initio study of the oxygen defect formation and oxide ion migration in (Sr1-xPrx)2FeO4±δ
